title: 108_s551
content: The Act is titled the "Southern Ute and Colorado Intergovernmental Agreement Implementation Act of 2004" and its purpose is outlined in the findings section. The Act aims to implement and enforce air quality control programs under the Clean Air Act and other programs developed in accordance with the Intergovernmental Agreement between the Southern Ute Indian Tribe and the State of Colorado. The curr_chunk outlines regulations for air quality control within the Reservation and the establishment of a joint Environmental Commission. The curr_chunk defines key terms such as Administrator, Commission, Intergovernmental Agreement, Reservation, State, and Tribe. SEC. 4. TRIBAL AUTHORITY. The Administrator can treat the Tribe as a State for air program applications under the Clean Air Act. If approved, the program applies to all air resources within the Reservation. Termination of the Intergovernmental Agreement results in the withdrawal of State treatment. SEC. 5. CIVIL ENFORCEMENT. The Tribe or Commission can take civil action in the United States District Court for failure to comply with air quality programs. SEC. 6. JUDICIAL REVIEW. SEC. 6. JUDICIAL REVIEW. Any decision by the Commission subject to appellate review by the United States Court of Appeals for the Tenth Circuit, applying the same standard as the Administrator. SEC. 7. DISCLAIMER. This Act does not modify provisions of the Clean Air Act or any lawful administrative rule, nor influence past or prospective judicial interpretations of those statutes. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
